intro: Stigmaphyllon laciniatum, commonly known as the lace fern, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that give it a lacy appearance. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually bright green and have a soft, feathery texture. Stigmaphyllon laciniatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
